item.description:
The final movie in this season's International Film Series, this film from Mexico shows how "Julian Perez, Mexico's most notorious leader of organized crime, must embark on a mission given to him by the only authority he respects... his mother. Joined by a colorful band of infamous criminals, Julian must risk his life to fulfill his mother's wish & rescue his brother from the war-ridden bowels of the most treacherous land in the world, IRAQ."

The film is in Spanish with English subtitles. 105 mins.

There is an after-film discussion (with potluck dessert buffet) led by one of the professors and very well attended and lively.

Time: 7:00 pm
Location:Manchester Community College, SBM Charitable Foundation Auditorium (in the "AST" building on the maps)
Directions: http://www.mcc.commnet.edu/about/directionsMCC.php
Park in LOT C, and you will be right in front of the entrance that leads to the auditorium.

I will try to be there around 6:30pm and we'll hang out in the lobby until it's time to find seats.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: FREE MOVIE - "Saving Private Perez" @ MCC
